Class Bigboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bigboard

  • public class Bigboard
extends java.lang.Object
    MIT License

    Copyright (c) 2018 Jake Chiang

    Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

    The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.

    THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.

    This class represents an immutable bit array data structure where each bit corresponds to a position on a 2D board. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping, i.e. the least significant bit is mapped to the lower left corner of the board and subsequent bits are mapped across each rank, starting at the first rank. So, a 3x3 board would be indexed as: 

     6 7 8
 3 4 5
 0 1 2
    Version:
    1.1.2

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bigboard

        public Bigboard(int width,
                int height)
        Creates a new bitboard of given width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the board. Must be greater than 0.
        height - The height of the board. Must be greater than 0.

      • Bigboard

        public Bigboard(int width,
                int height,
                long other)
        Constructs a new Bigboard of given width and height equal to another board of the same dimensions represented by a single long. Bits that don't fit on the board are discarded.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the board. Must be greater than 0.
        height - The height of the board. Must be greater than 0.
        other - The other board that this new Bigboard will equal.

      • Bigboard

        public Bigboard(Bigboard other)
        Constructs a new Bigboard equal to another.
        Parameters:
        other - The Bigboard which this new Bigboard will equal. Must not be null.

    • Method Detail

      • flipToString

        public static void flipToString(boolean flip)
        Set whether to flip the board representation of toString() vertically. If this is true, then toString() will be equivalent to toStringFlipped().
        Parameters:
        flip - Whether to make toString() act like toStringFlipped() and flip its representation of the board vertically.
        Since:
        v1.1.2
        See Also:
        toString(), toStringFlipped()

      • fileMask

        public static Bigboard fileMask(int width,
                                int height,
                                int file)
        Creates a mask of a file for a board of given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the board to make a mask for.
        height - The height of the board to make a mask for.
        file - The index of the file to make a mask of. Must specify a valid file on this board. Files are indexed with the left-most file as file 0.
        Returns:
        A board of the given dimensions where all bits are 0 except for the bits in the specified file, which are 1s.

      • rankMask

        public static Bigboard rankMask(int width,
                                int height,
                                int rank)
        Creates a mask of a rank for a board of given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the board to make a mask for.
        height - The height of the board to make a mask for.
        rank - The index of the rank to make a mask of. Must specify a valid rank on this board. Ranks are indexed with the lower-most rank as rank 0.
        Returns:
        A board of the given dimensions where all bits are 0 except for the bits in the specified rank, which are 1s.

        public int width()
        Returns the width of this board.
        Returns:

        public int height()

        public int size()

      • set

        public Bigboard set(int index)
        Sets the bit at the given index on the board to 1. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the position on the board to set to 1. Must be non-negative and less than board width * height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from setting the bit at the given index on this board to 1.

      • set

        public Bigboard set(int x,
                    int y)
        Sets the bit at the given position on the board to 1. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping, with (0,0) as the lower left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position on the board to set to 1. Must be non-negative and less than the board's width.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position on the board to set to 1. Must be non-negative and less than the board's height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from setting the bit at the given position on this board to 1.

      • unset

        public Bigboard unset(int index)
        Sets the bit at the given index on the board to 0. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the position on the board to set to 0. Must be non-negative and less than board width * height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from setting the bit at the given index on this board to 0.

      • unset

        public Bigboard unset(int x,
                      int y)
        Sets the bit at the given position on the board to 0. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping, with (0,0) as the lower left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position on the board to set to 0. Must be non-negative and less than the board's width.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position on the board to set to 0. Must be non-negative and less than the board's height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from setting the bit at the given position on this board to 0.

      • flip

        public Bigboard flip(int index)
        Flips the bit at the given index on the board (i.e. changes it to 0 if it is 1 and changes it to 1 if it is 0). Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the position on the board to flip. Must be non-negative and less than board width * height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from flipping the bit at the given index on this board.

      • flip

        public Bigboard flip(int x,
                     int y)
        Flips the bit at the given position on the board (i.e. changes it to 0 if it is 1 and changes it to 1 if it is 0). Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping, with (0,0) as the lower left corner.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position on the board to flip. Must be non-negative and less than the board's width.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position on the board to flip. Must be non-negative and less than the board's height.
        Returns:
        The board that results from flipping the bit at the given position on this board.

        Computes a bitwise left shift of a given number of bits and returns the result.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public Bigboard right(int amount)
        Computes a logical bitwise right shift of a given number of bits and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        amount - The number of bits to left shift this board. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        The board that results from bitwise logical right shifting this board by the given amount.

      • shiftLeft

        public Bigboard shiftLeft()
        Computes a bitwise left shift by 1 bit and returns the result. This is equivalent to left(1), but more efficient.
        Returns:
        The board that results from bitwise left shifting this board by 1.
        Since:
        v1.1.1
        See Also:
        left(int)

        public Bigboard shiftRight()
        Computes a bitwise right shift by 1 bit and returns the result. This is equivalent to right(1), but more efficient.
        Returns:
        The board that results from bitwise right shifting this board by 1.
        Since:
        v1.1.1
        See Also:
        right(int)

      • not

        public Bigboard not()
        Computes the bitwise NOT of this board and returns the result as a new board.
        Returns:
        The bitwise NOT of this board.

      • get

        public boolean get(int index)
        Returns the bit at the given index on the board. Bits are indexed according to a Little-Endian Rank-File mapping.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the position on the board to get the bit of. Must be non-negative and less than board width * height.
        Returns:
        True if the bit at the position is 1, false if it is 0.

      • get

        public boolean get(int x,
                   int y)
        Returns the bit at the given position on the board, as specified by its xy-coordinates. Positions are indexed with (0,0) as the lower left corner of the board and (width - 1, height - 1) as the upper right.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position on the board to get the bit of. Must be non-negative and less than the board width.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position on the board to get the bit of. Must be non-negative and less than the board height.
        Returns:
        True if the bit at the position is 1, false if it is 0.

      • lsb

        public Bigboard lsb()
        Returns a board of just the least-significant 1 bit (LS1B/LSB) of this board.
        Returns:
        The board of just the LS1B of this board.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • resetLsb

        public Bigboard resetLsb()
        Returns a copy of this board without its least-significant 1 bit (LS1B/LSB)
        Returns:
        The board that results from setting the LS1B of this board to 0.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • popLsb

        public Bigboard.Pair popLsb()
        Returns two boards respectively containing just the least-significant 1 bit (LS1B/LSB) of this board and a copy of this board but without the LS1B.

        This is equivalent to doing both lsb() and resetLsb().

        Returns:
        A pair of boards where the first is a board of just the LS1B of this board and the second is a copy of this board but without the LS1B.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • popCount

        public int popCount()
        Returns the population count (number of 1 bits) in this board.
        Returns:
        The number of 1 bits in this board.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • bitScanForward

        public int bitScanForward()
        Returns the index of the least significant 1 bit of this board.
        Returns:
        The index of the least significant 1 bit of this board. -1 if all bits in this board are 0.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • empty

        public boolean empty()
        Returns whether this board is empty (i.e. has no 1 bits).
        Returns:
        True if this board has no 1 bits, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String depicting the bits in their board positions. 0 bits are represented by '.', 1 bits are represented by 'X'. The board is constructed from the bits in Little-Endian Rank-File mapping.

        For example, a 4x4 board for the binary value of 25 would be: . . . . . . . . X . . . X . . X

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A representation of the 2D board showing 0 bits as '.' and 1 bits as 'X'.
        See Also:
        toStringFlipped()

      • toStringFlipped

        public java.lang.String toStringFlipped()
        Returns a String depicting the bits in their board positions. 0 bits are represented by '.', 1 bits are represented by 'X'. The board is constructed from the bits in Little-Endian Rank-File mapping, but flipped vertically so that the lowest bit appears in the top left corner. This is equivalent to the default representation given by toString(), but flipped vertically.

        For example, a 4x4 board for the binary value of 25 would be: X . . X X . . . . . . . . . . .

        Returns:
        A representation of the 2D board showing 0 bits as '.' and 1 bits as 'X'.
        Since:
        v1.1.2
        See Also:
        toString()

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)

        Two boards are considered equal if they are the same dimensions and all bits are equal.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
